TextView.android:text:
This application shows three acceleration graphs: vertical, horizontal and sideways.


Vertical acceleration is the acceleration of the bar from floor to hip, as you lift it (up is positive, down is negative). Ideally this increases throughout the entire lift.


Horizontal accelaration is the acceleration of the bar towards and away from you, as you lift it (away from you is positive, towards you is negative). Ideally this is 0 for the entire lift.


Sideways acceleration is the acceleration of the bar left and right as you lift it (left is positive, right is negative). Ideally this is 0 for the entire lift.


These acceleration values are plotted versus time, so you can see at what point during each lift your accelaration in a certain direction started to change.


Also remember that acceleration can be positive or negative. Negative acceleration indicates that the bar is moving in the negative direction at an increasing rate; 0 accelaration indicates that the bar is not moving or it is moving at an unchanging rate; positive accelaration indicates that the bar is moving in hte positive direction at an increasing rate.
